verses.verse: These are also proverbs <S%H4912><s%> of SHlomo <S%H8010><s%>, which the men <S%H582><s%> of Hizkiyah-yahu <S%H2396><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Y'hudah <S%H3063><s%> copied out <S%H6275><s%> <S%H8689><s%>.

It is the glory <S%H3519><s%> of 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> to conceal <S%H5641><s%> <S%H8687><s%> a thing <S%H1697><s%>: but the honour <S%H3519><s%> of kings <S%H4428><s%> is to search out <S%H2713><s%> <S%H8800><s%> a matter <S%H1697><s%>.
The heaven <S%H8064><s%> for height <S%H7312><s%>, and the earth <S%H776><s%> for depth <S%H6011><s%>, and the heart <S%H3820><s%> of kings <S%H4428><s%> is unsearchable <S%H2714><s%>.

Take away <S%H1898><s%> <S%H8800><s%> the dross <S%H5509><s%> from the silver <S%H3701><s%>, and there shall come forth <S%H3318><s%> <S%H8799><s%> a vessel <S%H3627><s%> for the finer <S%H6884><s%> <S%H8802><s%>.

Take away <S%H1898><s%> <S%H8800><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> from before <S%H6440><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%>, and his throne <S%H3678><s%> shall be established <S%H3559><s%> <S%H8735><s%> in righteousness <S%H6664><s%>.

Put not forth <S%H1921><s%> <S%H8691><s%> thyself in the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%>, and stand <S%H5975><s%> <S%H8799><s%> not in the place <S%H4725><s%> of great <S%H1419><s%> men:

For better <S%H2896><s%> it is that it be said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8800><s%> unto thee, Come up <S%H5927><s%> <S%H8798><s%> hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower <S%H8213><s%> <S%H8687><s%> in the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the prince <S%H5081><s%> whom thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> have seen <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8804><s%>.

Go not forth <S%H3318><s%> <S%H8799><s%> hastily <S%H4118><s%> to strive <S%H7378><s%> <S%H8800><s%>, lest thou know not what to do <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in the end <S%H319><s%> thereof, when thy neighbour <S%H7453><s%> hath put thee to shame <S%H3637><s%> <S%H8687><s%>.
Debate <S%H7378><s%> <S%H8798><s%> thy cause <S%H7379><s%> with thy neighbour <S%H7453><s%> himself; and discover <S%H1540><s%> <S%H8762><s%> not a secret <S%H5475><s%> to another <S%H312><s%>:
Lest he that heareth <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8802><s%> it put thee to shame <S%H2616><s%> <S%H8762><s%>, and thine infamy <S%H1681><s%> turn not away <S%H7725><s%> <S%H8799><s%>.

A word <S%H1697><s%> fitly <S%H212><s%> <S%H8675><s%> <S%H655><s%> spoken <S%H1696><s%> <S%H8803><s%> is like apples <S%H8598><s%> of gold <S%H2091><s%> in pictures <S%H4906><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%>.

As an earring <S%H5141><s%> of gold <S%H2091><s%>, and an ornament <S%H2481><s%> of fine gold <S%H3800><s%>, so is a wise <S%H2450><s%> reprover <S%H3198><s%> <S%H8688><s%> upon an `Ovedient <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8802><s%> ear <S%H241><s%>.

As the cold <S%H6793><s%> of snow <S%H7950><s%> in the time <S%H3117><s%> of harvest <S%H7105><s%>, so is a faithful <S%H539><s%> <S%H8737><s%> messenger <S%H6735><s%> to them that send <S%H7971><s%> <S%H8802><s%> him: for he refresheth <S%H7725><s%> <S%H8686><s%> the soul <S%H5315><s%> of his masters <S%H113><s%>.
Whoso <S%H376><s%> boasteth <S%H1984><s%> <S%H8693><s%> himself of a false <S%H8267><s%> gift <S%H4991><s%> is like clouds <S%H5387><s%> and wind <S%H7307><s%> without rain <S%H1653><s%>.

By long <S%H753><s%> forbearing <S%H639><s%> is a prince <S%H7101><s%> persuaded <S%H6601><s%> <S%H8792><s%>, and a soft <S%H7390><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> breaketh <S%H7665><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the bone <S%H1634><s%>.

Hast thou found <S%H4672><s%> <S%H8804><s%> honey <S%H1706><s%>? eat <S%H398><s%> <S%H8798><s%> so much as is sufficient <S%H1767><s%> for thee, lest thou be filled <S%H7646><s%> <S%H8799><s%> therewith, and vomit <S%H6958><s%> <S%H8689><s%> it.

Withdraw <S%H3365><s%> <S%H8685><s%> thy foot <S%H7272><s%> from thy neighbour's <S%H7453><s%> house <S%H1004><s%>; lest he be weary <S%H7646><s%> <S%H8799><s%> of thee, and so hate <S%H8130><s%> <S%H8804><s%> thee.

A man <S%H376><s%> that beareth <S%H6030><s%> <S%H8802><s%> false <S%H8267><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> against his neighbour <S%H7453><s%> is a maul <S%H4650><s%>, and a sword <S%H2719><s%>, and a sharp <S%H8150><s%> <S%H8802><s%> arrow <S%H2671><s%>.

Confidence <S%H4009><s%> in an unfaithful man <S%H898><s%> <S%H8802><s%> in time <S%H3117><s%> of trouble <S%H6869><s%> is like a broken <S%H7465><s%> tooth <S%H8127><s%>, and a foot <S%H7272><s%> out of joint <S%H4154><s%>.

As he that taketh away <S%H5710><s%> <S%H8688><s%> a garment <S%H899><s%> in cold <S%H7135><s%> weather <S%H3117><s%>, and as vinegar <S%H2558><s%> upon nitre <S%H5427><s%>, so is he that singeth <S%H7891><s%> <S%H8802><s%> songs <S%H7892><s%> to an heavy <S%H7451><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%>.

If thine enemy <S%H8130><s%> <S%H8802><s%> be hungry <S%H7457><s%>, give him bread <S%H3899><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%> <S%H8685><s%>; and if he be thirsty <S%H6771><s%>, give him water <S%H4325><s%> to drink <S%H8248><s%> <S%H8685><s%>:
For thou shalt heap <S%H2846><s%> <S%H8802><s%> coals of fire <S%H1513><s%> upon his head <S%H7218><s%>, and the YY <S%H3068><s%> shall reward <S%H7999><s%> <S%H8762><s%> thee.

The north <S%H6828><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> driveth away <S%H2342><s%> <S%H8787><s%> rain <S%H1653><s%>: so doth an angry <S%H2194><s%> <S%H8737><s%> countenance <S%H6440><s%> a backbiting <S%H5643><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%>.

It is better <S%H2896><s%> to dwell <S%H3427><s%> <S%H8800><s%> in the corner <S%H6438><s%> of the housetop <S%H1406><s%>, than with a brawling <S%H4079><s%> <S%H8675><s%> <S%H4066><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> and in a wide <S%H2267><s%> house <S%H1004><s%>.
As cold <S%H7119><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> to a thirsty <S%H5889><s%> soul <S%H5315><s%>, so is good <S%H2896><s%> news <S%H8052><s%> from a far <S%H4801><s%> country <S%H776><s%>.

A righteous <S%H6662><s%> man falling down <S%H4131><s%> <S%H8801><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> is as a troubled <S%H7515><s%> <S%H8737><s%> fountain <S%H4599><s%>, and a corrupt <S%H7843><s%> <S%H8716><s%> spring <S%H4726><s%>.

It is not good <S%H2896><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%> <S%H8800><s%> much <S%H7235><s%> <S%H8687><s%> honey <S%H1706><s%>: so for men to search <S%H2714><s%> their own glory <S%H3519><s%> is not glory <S%H3519><s%>.
He <S%H376><s%> that hath no rule <S%H4623><s%> over his own spirit <S%H7307><s%> is like a city <S%H5892><s%> that is broken down <S%H6555><s%> <S%H8803><s%>, and without walls <S%H2346><s%>.
